definition: intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The scarlet cord was a sign to the spies she wanted to be rescued by them.
sentences.chinese: 朱红线绳是给探子们的暗号，告诉他们她想获救。

sentences.english: But first, Joshua sent two spies across the Jordan.
sentences.chinese: 约书亚先派了两个探子过约旦河。

sentences.english: Are they the scouts of tribe beautiful?
Joshua sent these spies into Jericho to bring out Rahab and family.
sentences.chinese: 约书亚派这两个探子进耶利哥城把喇合和家人带出来。

sentences.english: One of the two spies Joshua sent into the promised land.
sentences.chinese: 约书亚所派进应许之地的两个探子之一。

sentences.english: So it's you!" said he; "but you are decidedly a spy then?"
The beater's job is to catch the snitch.
sentences.chinese: 打击手的任务是抓到金探子。

sentences.english: Was one of the 12 spies sent into the promised land by Moses.
sentences.chinese: 是摩西差派进入应许之地的12个探子之一。

definition: to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
submerged piles installed to prevent the passage of boats/(fig.) informer/spy
horse thief/(old) group of horse-mounted bandits
